LOSH.text: Northern Shrikes are a bit bigger than Loggerhead Shrikes.

Northern Shrikes often have fine grayish brown horizontal barring on the breast. Loggerhead Shrike breasts are pure white or only very faintly barred. NOTE: The Northern Shrike's barring becomes fainter as the feathers wear. In the spring it can be quite faint.
The black mask on the Northern Shrike is thinner than on the Loggerhead Shrike.
Northern's bills can be bigger, and the hook a bit larger, than with Loggerheads.
